TEI.2.document_title: James E. B. Austin to Emily M. Perry, 02-28-1826

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Biographical. Rapid immigration.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="02-28-1826">Feby 28th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My Dear *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I improve an opportunity which offers itself by a gentleman of sending this into the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned*, and I hope you will receive it in due time.*/p*
*p*A short time since I returned to this place; from which I have been absent two or three months on a place down on this *location_mentioned*river*/location_mentioned* where I am opening a *person_mentioned*farm */person_mentioned*and building a Cotton Gin, I shall remain here no longer than the absence of *person_mentioned*Stephen*/person_mentioned* compels me he is absent on a topographical tour to *location_mentioned*Galveston*/location_mentioned* to exicute a comission given him by the *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*. I expect him in*date_mentioned n="03-02-1826"> one or two days*/date_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*On my return to this *location_mentioned*place */location_mentioned*I found letters from you which gave me much pleasure and satisfaction. I hope you will not attribute my long silence to any thing but the remote distance and insolated state that I have been in for the last two or three months—Nothing would distress me more my Dr *person_mentioned*Emily*/person_mentioned* than for me to imagine that you should entertain the smallest doubt that I had abated my affection for you in the least or that I did not take and feel the deepest interest for your happiness, What has this world to endear me to it but my *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned* and her lovely *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*? altho debared the inexpressible pleasure and satisfaction of enjoying her society (and the sweet prattle of her little ones) I sincerely hope and flatter myself that the period is not far distant when we shall all be reunited, (if not under the same roof) so near that we can form a social circle and " far from the scenes of strife pass the innocent jest, and chaunt the merry glee"—then we can remind each other of "Auld Lang Syne " and congratulate ourselves that not withstanding the many visissitudes and difficulties we have encountered (and the great and heartfelt satisfaction afforded to the *person_mentioned*Enemies of our house */person_mentioned*by its downfall) we have proved to the *location_mentioned*world*/location_mentioned* that regardless of them all—We have accomplished an enterprize that will perpetuate our name and place it with honor on the page of history It will then be our turn to triumph—shall we do so ? I can see a sentiment of just Resentment pervades your Breast—but I also see a generous principle a something so noble rising still above that—checking the first impulse of anger—and appealing to reason to treat the past with silent contempt—Our old *person_mentioned*Enemies */person_mentioned*will in a few years more dwindle into insignificance and would lick the dust from our shoes to gain a favor—It will then be a satisfaction a "heavenly satisfaction ["] for me to assist them—That is the revenge which will be sweet to me—*/p*
*p*I was truly shocked to hear of the murder committed on the person of *person_mentioned*Wm M Perry*/person_mentioned* I receivd the letter of *person_mentioned*Saml Perry*/person_mentioned* to my *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned* informing him of the circumstance and containing an advertisement, you may assure him that every exertion in our power will be made to apprehend the *person_mentioned*Villian*/person_mentioned* that he may receive the punishment he so justly merits.*/p*
*p*We have nothing new the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned* wears a more flourishing aspect at this time than it ever has before, there is a prospect of an overflowing Emigration this *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1826">spring */date_mentioned*and next *date_mentioned n="Fall- 1826">fall */date_mentioned*of some of the most respectable men in the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Andrews*/person_mentioned* has arrived safe I have not seen him yet—his *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned* is well and much pleased with the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I wish you to inform *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* that by a *person_mentioned*Mr Benjamin Milam*/person_mentioned* (Brother of *person_mentioned*Milam*/person_mentioned* at the *location_mentioned*Mines*/location_mentioned*) who lately arrived from the *location_mentioned*city of Mexico*/location_mentioned*—I learned that *person_mentioned*Dr Baldwin*/person_mentioned* has accumulated a handsome fortune in that *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*; he has purchased a *location_mentioned*coffee plantation */location_mentioned*on the *location_mentioned*River Guazicualco*/location_mentioned* on the *location_mentioned*Pacific Ocean*/location_mentioned* where he now [is?] and has gained the confidence and esteem of all who know him. Also *person_mentioned*Cousin Henry Austin*/person_mentioned* lives in the *location_mentioned*city of Jalapa*/location_mentioned* (between *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned*) engaged in the *person_mentioned*commission */person_mentioned*business—*/p*
*p*Remember me to all my *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*acquaintances*/person_mentioned*—write me often my Dr *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*—you must know that anything from the pen of my *person_mentioned*sister*/person_mentioned* to me is interesting, kiss all the *person_mentioned*little ones*/person_mentioned* for me, tell *person_mentioned*Joel*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned* their *person_mentioned*uncles*/person_mentioned* are much pleased with their improvement in writing we shall soon Expect to secure a specimen of their writing in the form of a letter.*/p*
*p*Remember me particularly to *person_mentioned*Mr. Perry*/person_mentioned* This letter must be my excuse for not writing to him.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jas E B Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mrs Emily M. Perry*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Potosi. Missouri*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*P. S. I am not married yet nor is there any likelihood at present.*/p* */div1*
